==Events==
*[[87 BC]] &ndash; Crown Prince Fuling, later [[Emperor Zhao of Han]], is named as [[Emperor Wu of Han]]'s successor and heir to the throne. Emperor Wu dies two days later.
*[[1309]] &ndash; [[Pope Clement V]] imposes excommunication, interdiction, and a general prohibition of all commercial intercourse against [[Venice]], which had unjustly seized on Ferrara, a fief of the Patrimony of Peter.
*[[1329]] &ndash; [[Pope John XXII]] issues his ''In Agro Dominico'' condemning some writings of [[Meister Eckhart]] as heretical.
*[[1513]] &ndash; Spanish explorer [[Juan Ponce de León]] reaches the northern end of [[The Bahamas]] on his first voyage to Florida.
*[[1613]] &ndash; The first English child born in Canada at [[Cuper's Cove, Newfoundland and Labrador|Cuper's Cove]], [[Newfoundland (island)|Newfoundland]] to [[Nicholas Guy]].
*[[1625]] &ndash; [[Charles I of England|Charles I]] becomes King of England, Scotland and Ireland as well as claiming the title [[English claims to the French throne|King of France]].
*[[1782]] &ndash; [[Charles Watson-Wentworth, 2nd Marquess of Rockingham]] becomes [[Prime Minister of the United Kingdom]].
*[[1794]] &ndash; The [[Federal government of the United States|United States Government]] establishes a permanent [[United States Navy|navy]] and authorizes the building of [[Original six frigates of the United States Navy|six frigates]].
*  1794   &ndash; Denmark and Sweden form a [[neutral country|neutrality]] compact.
*[[1809]] &ndash; [[Peninsular War]]: A combined [[French First Empire|Franco]]-[[Duchy of Warsaw|Polish]] force defeats the Spanish in the [[Battle of Ciudad-Real]].
*[[1812]] &ndash; Hugh McGary Jr. establishes what is now [[Evansville, Indiana]] on a bend in the Ohio River.
*[[1814]] &ndash; [[War of 1812]]: In central [[Alabama]], U.S. forces under General [[Andrew Jackson]] defeat the [[Creek (people)|Creek]] at the [[Battle of Horseshoe Bend (1814)|Battle of Horseshoe Bend]].
*[[1836]] &ndash; [[Texas Revolution]]: [[Goliad massacre]] &ndash; [[Antonio López de Santa Anna]] orders the Mexican army to kill about 400 Texas POWs at [[Goliad, Texas]].
*[[1851]] &ndash; First reported sighting of the [[Yosemite Valley]] by Europeans.
*[[1871]] &ndash; The [[1871 England versus Scotland rugby union match|first]] international [[rugby football]] match, when [[Scotland national rugby union team|Scotland]] defeats [[England national rugby union team|England]] in [[Edinburgh]] at [[Raeburn Place]].
*[[1881]] &ndash; Rioting takes place in [[Basingstoke]] in protest against the daily vociferous promotion of [[Teetotalism]] by the [[Salvation Army]].
*[[1884]] &ndash; A mob in [[Cincinnati]], [[Ohio]], attacks members of a [[jury]] who had returned a verdict of [[manslaughter]] in a clear case of [[murder]], and then over the next few days would [[Cincinnati riots of 1884|riot and destroy the courthouse]].
*[[1886]] &ndash; Famous [[Apache]] warrior, [[Geronimo]], surrenders to the U.S. Army, ending the main phase of the [[Apache Wars]].
*[[1890]] &ndash; A tornado strikes [[Louisville, Kentucky]], killing 76 and injuring 200.
*[[1899]] &ndash; [[Emilio Aguinaldo]] leads [[Philippine Revolutionary Army|Filipino forces]] for the only time during the [[Philippine–American War]] at the [[Battle of Marilao River]].
*[[1910]] &ndash; A fire during a barn-dance in [[Ököritófülpös]], Hungary, kills 312.
*[[1915]] &ndash; [[Typhoid Mary]], the first [[Asymptomatic carrier|healthy carrier]] of disease ever identified in the United States, is put in [[quarantine]], where she would remain for the rest of her life.
*[[1918]] &ndash; [[Bessarabia]] joins the [[Kingdom of Romania]].
*[[1938]] &ndash; [[Second Sino-Japanese War]]: The [[Battle of Taierzhuang]] takes place.
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Yugoslavia]]n Air Force officers topple the [[Axis powers|pro-Axis]] government in a [[Yugoslavian military coup of March 27, 1941|bloodless coup]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; World War II: [[Battle of the Komandorski Islands]] &ndash; In the [[Aleutian Islands]] the battle begins when United States Navy forces intercept Japanese attempting to reinforce a [[garrison]] at [[Kiska]].
*[[1945]] &ndash; World War II: [[Operation Starvation]], the aerial mining of Japan's ports and waterways begins. Argentina [[Argentina in World War II|declares war]] on the Axis Powers.
*[[1948]] &ndash; The Second Congress of the [[Workers Party of North Korea]] is convened.
*[[1958]] &ndash; [[Nikita Khrushchev]] becomes [[Premier of the Soviet Union]].
*[[1963]] &ndash; [[Beeching Axe]]: [[Richard Beeching|Dr. Richard Beeching]] issues a report calling for huge cuts to the United Kingdom's rail network.
*[[1964]] &ndash; The [[Good Friday Earthquake]], the most powerful earthquake in U.S. history at a [[moment magnitude scale|magnitude]] of 9.2 strikes [[South Central Alaska]], killing 125 people and inflicting massive damage to the city of [[Anchorage, Alaska|Anchorage]].
*[[1975]] &ndash; Construction of the [[Trans-Alaska Pipeline System]] begins.
*[[1976]] &ndash; The first 4.6 miles of the [[Washington Metro]] [[subway (rail)|subway]] system opens.
*[[1977]] &ndash; [[Tenerife airport disaster]]: Two [[Boeing 747]] [[airliner]]s collide on a foggy runway on [[Tenerife]] in the [[Canary Islands]], killing 583 (all 248 on [[KLM]] and 335 on [[Pan Am]]). Sixty-one survived on the [[Pan Am]] flight. This is the worst aviation accident in history.
*[[1980]] &ndash; The Norwegian oil platform [[Alexander L. Kielland (platform)|Alexander L. Kielland]] collapses in the [[North Sea]], killing 123 of its crew of 212.
*  1980   &ndash; [[Silver Thursday]]: A steep fall in [[silver]] prices, resulting from [[Nelson Bunker Hunt|the Hunt Brothers]] attempting to [[corner the market]] in silver, led to panic on commodity and [[futures exchange]]s.
*[[1981]] &ndash; The [[Solidarity (Polish trade union)|Solidarity]] movement in Poland stages a [[1981 warning strike in Poland|warning strike]], in which at least 12 million Poles walk off their jobs for four hours.
*[[1986]] &ndash; A [[car bomb]] explodes at [[Russell Street Bombing|Russell Street Police HQ]] in [[Melbourne]], killing one police officer and injuring 21 people.
*[[1990]] &ndash; The United States begins broadcasting [[TV Martí]], an anti-[[Fidel Castro|Castro]] propaganda network, to [[Cuba]].
*[[1993]] &ndash; [[Jiang Zemin]] is appointed [[President of the People's Republic of China]].
*  1993   &ndash; Italian former minister and [[Christian Democracy (Italy)|Christian Democracy]] leader [[Giulio Andreotti]] is accused of [[mafia]] allegiance by the tribunal of [[Palermo]].
*[[1998]] &ndash; The [[Food and Drug Administration]] approves [[Viagra]] for use as a treatment for male [[impotence]], the first pill to be approved for this condition in the United States.
*[[1999]] &ndash; The [[Kosovo war]]: Yugoslav SAM downed [[F117]]A, the first and only kill of the stealth aircraft.
*[[2000]] &ndash; A [[Phillips explosion of 2000|Phillips Petroleum plant explosion]] in [[Pasadena, Texas]] kills one and injures 71.
*[[2002]] &ndash; [[Passover massacre]]: A [[Palestinian people|Palestinian]] [[suicide bomber]] kills 29 people partaking of the [[Passover Seder|Passover meal]] in [[Netanya]], [[Israel]].
*  2002   &ndash; [[Nanterre massacre]]: In [[Nanterre]], [[France]], a gunman opened fire at the end of a town council meeting, resulting in the deaths of eight councilors and the injury of 19 others.
*[[2004]] &ndash; {{HMS|Scylla|F71|6}}, a decommissioned [[Leander class frigate]], is sunk as an artificial reef off [[Cornwall]], the first of its kind in Europe.
*[[2009]] &ndash; The dam forming [[Situ Gintung]], an artificial lake in [[Indonesia]], fails, killing at least 99 people.
*  2009   &ndash; A [[suicide bombing|suicide bomber]] [[2009 Jamrud mosque bombing|kills at least 48]] at a mosque in the [[Khyber Agency]] of [[Pakistan]].
